questions.question: In hypothesis testing, what is the null hypothesis?

answers.a: The hypothesis that there is no significant difference or relationship between variables.
answers.b: The hypothesis that there is a significant difference or relationship between variables.

explanations.a: The null hypothesis assumes no significant difference or relationship between variables until proven otherwise.
explanations.b: This statement is incorrect. The null hypothesis assumes no significant difference or relationship between variables until proven otherwise.

questions.question: What is the alternative hypothesis in hypothesis testing?

answers.a: The hypothesis that there is no significant difference or relationship between variables.
answers.b: The hypothesis that there is a significant difference or relationship between variables.

explanations.a: This statement is incorrect. The alternative hypothesis assumes a significant difference or relationship between variables.
explanations.b: The alternative hypothesis assumes a significant difference or relationship between variables, and it is what the researcher wants to prove.

questions.question: What is a Type I error in hypothesis testing?

answers.a: Rejecting the null hypothesis when it is true.
answers.b: Failing to reject the null hypothesis when it is false.

explanations.a: Type I error occurs when the researcher rejects the null hypothesis when it is actually true.
explanations.b: This statement is incorrect. Type II error occurs when the researcher fails to reject the null hypothesis when it is actually false.

questions.question: What is a Type II error in hypothesis testing?

answers.a: Rejecting the null hypothesis when it is true.
answers.b: Failing to reject the null hypothesis when it is false.

explanations.a: This statement is incorrect. Type I error occurs when the researcher rejects the null hypothesis when it is actually true.
explanations.b: Type II error occurs when the researcher fails to reject the null hypothesis when it is actually false.

questions.question: What is the p-value in hypothesis testing?

answers.a: The probability of observing the data given that the null hypothesis is true.
answers.b: The probability of rejecting the null hypothesis when it is true.

explanations.a: The p-value represents the probability of observing the data given that the null hypothesis is true. It is used to make decisions in hypothesis testing.
explanations.b: This statement is incorrect. The p-value is not the probability of rejecting the null hypothesis when it is true.
